passages.text: Given the success to date of nicotine pouches in the US, there has been rising interest in the category in Europe from both investors and industry players. Europe is a relatively nascent NP market but is more developed in Scandinavian markets like Sweden. The European NP market is currently dominated by BAT and PMI with a combined \(\sim 60\%\) share. Although barriers to entry are relatively low, we think that large tobacco players are strongly positioned to leverage their distribution capabilities, drive science- backed innovation and support category development through marketing

Longer term the development of the category in Europe will depend on how the regulatory landscape evolves. Currently this landscape is very fragmented. The latest version of the EU TPD seeks to harmonise the treatment of NP across the union but the proposed high levels of excise have been met with resistance from key supporters of the category, like Sweden. We would view a harmonised approach across Europe with comparatively low levels of excise as being a positive outcome for smokers seeking to switch to NP and the broader nicotine industry

We currently forecast a \(\sim 20\%\) volume CAGR for European NP for both BAT and PMI to FY 29E. This is consistent with Euromonitor's expectation that the category will increase by \(2.4x\) in volume terms over the 5 years to 2029. Our scenario analysis looks at those 18 markets where pouches are available in Europe and determines a potential profit pool of 3.7bn assuming daily consumption of 2 pouches per adult nicotine user rising to 18.3bn at 10 pouches / day. For reference Sweden is Europe's most developed NP market with average daily consumption at \(\sim 8\) pouches which equates to 14.6bn.
Fig 23:Annual EBIT Contribution (m) of European Pouches

... Figure 23 demonstrates the potential EBIT of the European NP category assuming a retail selling price (RSP) of €5.00 per can, a \(100\%\) retailer markup, and a \(50\%\) EBIT margin. This indicates a range of category value from €3,653m at 2 pouches/ day rising to €18,265m at 10 pouches /day. At the current Swedis rate of consumption of 8 pouches/day we arrive at a NP category value of €14,612m. Figure 23 also provides some sensitivity analysis on differing levels of market share."
Nicotine NGP Expert Call Feedback: Key Takeaways (DB report): Listen to the replay here

We hosted a call with Aleksandra Samulewicz. She was "in the room" at the genesis of IQOS and spent 19 years at PMI before moving to JTI in 2023 & embarking on a consulting career in 2025. We explored the evolving NGP landscape drawing on her experience across roles in RRP strategy, commercialisation, and R&D.

IQOS domination of HTP difficult to overcome. PMI has invested heavily in IQOS and its success is attributable to understanding and supporting the consumer through transition, in turn creating substantial brand loyalty. BAT & JTI's devices are comparable but it remains to be seen how they evolve their consumer engagement strategies. There were doubts about IQOS's ability to hit \(10\%\) share of volumes.

Pouch category has substantial potential. Her view is that growth is unlikely to slow down any time soon with the US category potentially being 10x current volumes, with ZYN remaining the dominant brand in the US saying that "ZYN is the new Marlboro".

Vaping challenges to persist. The vape category has experienced several challenges, some relating to regulation and enforcement but vapes have also struggled with negative consumer perceptions, inconsistent product quality, and a lack of a clear USP.

Results Broadly In Line: Net sales broadly flat at DKK 2,361m (DBE 2,384m), reflecting the Mac Baren acquisition \((+7\%)\) and FX \((- 3\%)\) . The \(4\%\) organic decline largely reflects a \(3\%\) drag from the discontinuation of ZYN distribution in the US. Adj EBITDA \(- 14.5\%\) to DKK 499m, implying margin contraction of \(\sim 340\) bps to \(21.1\%\) (DBE \(21.6\%\) ). This reflects changes in product- mix, investments in the European MRC business and the discontinuation of ZYN in the US. Adj EPS fell \(\sim 20\%\) to DKK 3.3 (DBE DKK 3.3).

FY Guidance Maintained But FX Headwinds Flagged: FX headwinds from a weaker USD will push net sales to the lower end of the DKK 9.1- 9.5bn range. Management notes that ZYN's discontinuation will not affect YoY comparisons from Q3, and new superstores opening in H2 are expected to drive growth. Although H2 margins should be slightly higher than H1, investments in European market share and nicotine pouch expansion will exert some downward pressure.

Forecasts and Valuation: Reflecting the updated guidance results in adj EPS dewindades of \(- 2.3\%\) to DKK 11.3p / - 1.7% to DKK 11.7 / - 1.2% to DKK 12.2 / - 0.7% to DKK 12.8 in FY 25- 28E respectively. Our forecasts indicate a 4 year adj EPS CAGR of - 1.6%. The shares trade on 8.1x P/E and 6.9x EV/EBITDA, with a FCF yield (Equity) of \(11.4\%\) and a dividend yield of \(9.5\%\) for FY25E. Maintain Hold, DKK 90 TP

Altria Takes On! the FDA (DB report)- Altria to Launch On! Plus in Select US States Despite Not Yet Receiving FDA Authorisation: Altria is set to launch its new, more moist nicotine pouch product, On! Plus, in North Carolina, Texas, and Florida this Autumn, featuring three flavours and three strengths.- Significant FDA PMTA Review Delays: The launch highlights the FDA's continued failure to meet its PMTA review deadlines, with the on! Plus application now 242 days overdue, despite extensive scientific documentation supporting its harm reduction claims.- Strategic Launch and Potential PMTA Pressure: The limited state launch by Altria appears to be a calculated move to pressure the FDA, potentially forcing an acceleration or overhaul of the PMTA process, which could impact many other pending product applications.

Soraaya Benchikh has stepped down as BAT's CFO and from the Board: Soraya had served as CFO for 16 months, previously working for the company for 20 years. She will support the transition until December 31, 2025. Recruitment Process Underway: In the interim, Javed Iqbal, Director of Digital and Information, has been appointed as the temporary CFO while a permanent successor is sought. Javed has previously acted as the Interim Finance Director from May 2023 to April 2024

The Equity Rating Dispersion Chart depicts the following:

The proportion of recommendations that are rated "buy," "sell" and "hold" over the previous 12 months. This is shown for securities issued in the stated region e.g. "Europe Universe". See rating definitions below. This is represented by the "Companies Covered" bars in the chart. The percentage value displayed above the bar is the proportion as a percentage. E.g. 50% above the "buy" / "Companies Covered" bar means that 50% of DB's equity research covered companies over the past 12 months have a "buy" rating.
Next to each of the three respective bars showing the proportion of "buy," "sell" and "hold" recommendations we provide two additional bars to show:

- The proportion of "buy," "sell" or "hold" recommendations where Deutsche Bank and/or Affiliates provided MIFID Investment or Ancillary Services in the past 12 months. This is represented in the "MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services" bar. The percentage value displayed above the bar shows the proportion of Companies Covered with the given rating where DB has also provided MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services in the past 12 months. E.g. 50% above the "Cos. w/ MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services" bar means 50% of the Companies Covered with the rating stated above also received MIFID Investment and Ancillary Services from DB.

- The proportion of "buy" (or "sell" or "hold") recommendations where Deutsche Bank and/or Affiliates has provided Investment Banking services in the past 12 months for which it has received compensation. The percentage value displayed above the bar shows the proportion of Companies Covered with the stated rating where DB has also provided Investment Banking services in the past 12 months. E.g. 50% above the "Cos. w/ Investment Banking relationship" bar means 50% of the Companies Covered with the rating stated also have an Investment Banking Relationship with DB.
Buy: Based on a current 12- month view of TSR, we recommend that investors buy the stock.
Sell: Based on a current 12- month view of TSR, we recommend that investors sell the stock.
Hold: We take a neutral view on the stock 12- months out and, based on this time horizon, do not recommend either a Buy or Sell.
TSR = Total Shareholder Return. Percentage change in share price from current price to projected target price plus projected dividend yield
Newly issued research recommendations and target prices supersede previously published research.
